Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Goal: Identify cases where there is a direct succession sequence: Approve Purchase Requisition followed immediately by Create Order followed immediately by Confirm Order with no other activities in between. Then among those cases, where the time between Create Order and Confirm Order > 5 days. Then exclude those cases entirely.

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Approach: Find case_id that has the sequence with direct succession and time >5 days between the two last events. Then select all events where case_id NOT IN those case_ids.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: For each event of a case, we can check if its activity = Approve Purchase Requisition and the next activity by timestamp = Create Order and the next next activity = Confirm Order. That ensures direct succession.

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - IND
Text: Using pattern matching MATCH_RECOGNIZE if DuckDB supports it? Safer to use window functions.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: WITH ordered_events AS SELECT case_id, activity, timestamp, LEAD(activity, 1) OVER PARTITION BY case_id ORDER BY timestamp as next_activity, LEAD(timestamp, 1) as next_timestamp, LEAD(activity, 2) as next_next_activity, LEAD(timestamp, 2) as next_next_timestamp FROM event_log, excluded_cases AS SELECT DISTINCT case_id FROM ordered_events WHERE activity = Approve Purchase Requisition AND next_activity = Create Order AND next_next_activity = Confirm Order AND DATEDIFF(day, next_timestamp, next_next_timestamp) > 5

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Better: next_next_timestamp - next_timestamp > INTERVAL 5 days. That is more precise.

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: If multiple such sequences in same case, if any with time >5 days, case is excluded. Edge cases: pattern but diff <=5 days keep case, no pattern keep case.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Testing mental scenario: Case1 Approve day1 Create day1 Confirm day1 diff <5 keep. Case2 Approve Create other Confirm not direct keep. Case3 Approve Create Confirm diff=6 exclude.
